intro: Echites maculatus, commonly known as the spotted echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
